#summary updateByKey(key[properties])
#labels api,1.0

*Category*:

[ModelClassFunctions Model Class Functions]

*Description*:

Updates all properties for the records that match the where argument. Property names and values can be passed in either using named arguments or as a struct to the properties argument. By default objects will not be instantiated and therefore callbacks and validations are not invoked. You can change this behavior by passing in instantiate=true. Returns the number of records that were updated.

*Return Type*:

Numeric

*History*:

-

*Parameters*:

|| *Name* || *Type* || *Required* || *Default* || *Description* ||
|| *where* || numeric, string or list || true || - || See documentation for `findByKey` ||
|| *properties* || struct || false ||   || See documentation for `new` ||

*Examples*:

{{{
<cfset post = model("post").updateByKey(33, params.post)>
}}}

{{{
<cfset post = model("post").updateByKey(key=33, title="New version of Wheels just released", published=1)>
}}}
